qas.question: What company developed the first electronic circuit that could be mass produced and was durable enough to be fired from a gun?
What was the plate used for anti-aircraft proximity fuses in World War II made out of?
Who was in charge of the Centralab Division of Globe Union when the PCB used in anti-aircraft fuses was invented?
What award did Rubinstein win in 1984 for his contributions?
Where did Harry Rubinstein attend college?

plausible_answers.text: an electronic circuit that could withstand being fired from a gun, and could be produced in quantity

qas.question: During World War I, the development of the anti-aircraft proximity fuse required what?
In 1994, the IEEE awarded whom the Cledo Brunetti Award?
Ms. Harriet W. Rubenstein was the former head of which division?
Mr. Rubenstein was honored in 1994 by which university?

context: During World War II, the development of the anti-aircraft proximity fuse required <b5_0>an electronic circuit that could withstand being fired from a gun, and could be produced in quantity<b5_0/>. The Centralab Division of <a0_0>Globe Union<a0_0/> submitted a proposal which met the requirements: a <a1_0>ceramic<a1_0/> plate would be screenprinted with metallic paint for conductors and carbon material for resistors, with ceramic disc capacitors and subminiature vacuum tubes soldered in place. The technique proved viable, and the resulting patent on the process, which was classified by the U.S. Army, was assigned to Globe Union. It was not until 1984 that the Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE) awarded <b6_0>Mr. <a2_0>Harry W. Rubinstein<b6_0/><a2_0/>, the former head of <b7_0>Globe Union's Centralab Division<b7_0/>, its coveted <a3_0>Cledo Brunetti Award<a3_0/> for early key contributions to the development of printed components and conductors on a common insulating substrate. As well, Mr. Rubinstein was honored in 1984 by his alma mater, <b8_0>the <a4_0>University of Wisconsin-Madison<b8_0/><a4_0/>, for his innovations in the technology of printed electronic circuits and the fabrication of capacitors.
